content.description:
Contrary to it's neighbor,

Little Devil

has the best rock in all of

Hellgate

, thats right, I said it. Only about 40 - 50 feet in length, you'll wish this route went on forever. Well protected climbing w/ excellent movement and a high crux make this a really nice find. Score!
content.protection: Quickdraws for 7 or 8 bolts and something for the anchor.
content.location:
The only bolted route right of

Crack of Noon.

climbs.name: Crack of Noon Club
climbs.fa: FA: Dan Caruso, FFA: Craig Dillon 92'

content.description:
A delicate, traditional line seated in the bosom of

East Hellgate

. This right-facing, right-leaning corner weighs in at 5.8, but boasts old school flare that demands constant attention. Careful, slow movement make this short route feel about twice as long. The protection is easy to place, but can be tricky to find at times with the rock being questionable in some areas.  A single-pitch adventure of epic proportions! Try not to die.
content.protection: A single rack of cams up to a #3 camalot or 3.5 inches. Draws and long runners.
